Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: ADAMANT and its security level come in all shapes and sizes  ADAMANT is one of a kind and not your typical messenger. It provides its users with complete anonymity and privacy and protects chats and coin transfers from interception ‚Äì all this is no idle boast. The development team regularly studies the flaws of popular messengers and strives to exclude them from ADAMANT.  This very article is a summary of hard work and its results, so be all eyes and ears!  Anonymity  The messenger requires neither phone numbers nor first or last names. It does not even register a user under a specific nickname. As soon as an account is created, users will get a unique passphrase and an account‚Äôs ID number. This data is more than enough to start chatting and make transactions. Indeed, such a registration process is more convenient than the regular ones ‚Äì it is quick, as it does not require any verifications or specific information about users.  What‚Äôs more, ADAMANT will never reveal a user‚Äôs IP address because all messages are a part of the blockchain system. This works the same for Tor Browser, for instance.  Correspondence security  Only a sender and a recipient can see the chats‚Äô content and this is a 100% guaranty, which ADAMANT is happy to provide. To that end, several features make this possible.  Blockchain is on guard  In fact, all the messages sent and received via ADAMANT are recognized as transactions, which are made and stored in the messenger‚Äôs decentralized registry. The blockchain system protects the content, too. Indeed, this kind of storage is safer than any other, as it is impossible to break into the blockchain‚Äôs repository and retrieve information from a decentralized server.  No one can edit or delete messages and their content. Indeed, data stored in the blockchain system is unchangeable, so no third parties can ascribe anything to users.  E2EE  Now, blockchain enthusiasts may object saying that all the blockchain data is ¬´transparent¬ª so that everyone can get access to it. However, ADAMANT uses E2EE (End-to-End encryption) that is based on two keys: public and private. To keep it short, encryption requires a sender‚Äôs private key and a recipient‚Äôs public key. Consequently, a message is encrypted on a sender‚Äôs device and then is  decrypted on a recipient‚Äôs device. Besides, a private key is never transferred into the network. If you want to learn more on the matter, have a look at this article.  Privacy as a native feature  ADAMANT accounts cannot be influenced by anyone externally. Indeed, even developers cannot ban or block the messenger‚Äôs users and delete their messages. There are neither administrators nor moderators so that each person in the messenger‚Äôs system is equal to another.  Corporations and governments do not sponsor ADAMANT. As a matter of fact, node holders support its system and receive the project‚Äôs tokens in exchange for their aid. Therefore, the app does not need to sell out its users' data to survive.  New functions ‚Äî more safety  Back in February, the development team updated ADAMANT Blockchain Explorer that is a web service for researching the blockchain system. The latest update allows hiding both transactions and their fees. To that end, no third parties can determine who and when is in correspondence and the messages‚Äô content is safe, too. However, these transactions and their metadata can still be compromised with the aid of API.  Mixer is another innovation made by the ADAMANT team. This technology covers up all the tracks and traces of any transaction, which makes it impossible to detect the chatters. Mixer distributes transactions between several wallets and sends tokens at different times, piece by piece. Senders can use public Mixer or set one on their own.  The source code of ADAMANT is fully public and this is a great opportunity to make sure that all of the aforesaid is completely true. Furthermore, it helps the ADAMANT team to work better as any enthusiast or developer can make their suggestions on the messenger‚Äôs performance and try finding possible flaws.

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: I see Obyte doesn't have a messenger, they plan to build a messenger within unreal timeframe of 1 month.  Quote When? The development will be divided into 4 stages: ‚óè Milestone I - 16 August: forking BIoT wallet or starting clean, first mockups from UX/UI designer, branding. [Payment on finish: 3000 EUR] ‚óè Milestone II - 2 September: designs from UX/UI designer, chat list, individual chats, pairing, requesting/sending/receiving bytes. [Payment on finish: 9000 EUR] ‚óè Milestone III - 19 September: P2P exchange, P2P cryptocurrency betting, P2P sports betting. [Payment on finish: 8000 EUR] ‚óè Milestone IV - 25 September: testing, polishing, unexpected features and releasing to app stores. [Payment on finish: 5000 EUR]  Quote alvarlaigna27.08.2019 Hi, I am technical lead and project manager of recent Obyte grant to make an encrypted chat app that has Obyte wallet inside. Basically like official Obyte wallet that has wallets, but other way around - focused more to P2P functionality than the wallet functionality. This was the grant proposal https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/540572941222543362/603589943373070346/Chat_app_for_Obyte_GRANT_PROPOSAL.pdf  Before we finish the first milestone (there are some screens missing), we would like to ask community feedback and suggestions on interactive InVision demo, so we would know that we are on the right track. https://invis.io/F6TN3SR2CQE

Body: The vote on the exchange Coindeal continues.  ADAMANT confidently moving to 1 place, which gives the right to listing on the same exchange. Now position ADAMANT Messenger - 17th place. Continue to vote, and invite friends and acquaintances, because you can earn ADM tokens for votes.  If you want to support our team on Coindeal, you will have to sign up first. After you finish your registration, you will need to pass a certain verification, which allows voting. Verification requires an ID scan or picture and a shot of you holding your ID. All requests are moderated, so it may take up to 24 hours to finish your verification. However, it usually takes an hour or so. As soon as you pass verification, you will be able to give a vote for ADAMANT using this link.  Each vote grants you 10 ADM. Consequently, your profit will amount to 100 ADM. It means that you have to vote at least 10 times to receive this sum of tokens. If you want to get all of it, you will have to mail us as soon as you finished the registration process. Within 10 days and after you vote for ADAMANT 10 times respectively, mail us again and attach screenshots confirming your participation. Here is an address you need to write to us: bounty@adamant.im. Make shots right after you give your votes on Coindeal, so that you will not forget doing so later.

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: In order to provide you with the best conditions of anonymity while using the messenger, we've recently launched web-app of ADAMANT within the '.onion' domain. Therefore, you can always access the app through the glorious Tor network and its browser.  This release, in case you'll prefer to use it, minimizes the chances of your messaging device and location to be tracked (as much as it is currently possible) ‚Äì no matter what government jurisdiction are you visiting or how conscientious are the internet providers around.  In fine, here's what makes guys like Jason Bourne feel happy ‚Äì https://medium.com/adamant-im/adamant-or-tor-ill-take-both-dac53f87ee6a

Body: Stablecoins are to be the key element in convenient use of cryptocurrencies by those, who are closely following the actual value in their pockets. After many years spent by millions of crypto fans around the market, most part prefers to hold some part of active resources in national currencies because of coins volatility.  With this in mind, we've just supported the first stablecoin on ADAMANT ‚Äì StableUSD. It becomes available via web-app (https://nightly.adamant.im/) in 'full mode.'  Backed & balanced by United States dollar, USDS is issued by Canadian "Stably Blockchain Labs, Inc." and available for your personal research at https://www.stably.io/  Article on this update in dev blog ‚Äì https://medium.com/adamant-im/the-first-stablecoin-in-adamant-meet-usds-by-stably-42106aae239

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: Exchange rates in ADAMANT  Seeing balances in USD and other traditional currencies is convenient but not safe: to receive this data the app accesses third-party resources leaving user IP-address there.  Therefore we developed InfoService for ADAMANT apps that collects that kind of data.  Security and data sources  InfoService is an independent library that collects and stores data.  The source code is available on GitHub so you can deploy InfoService on your server. For best privacy we recommend setting up all ADAMANT services on your own, including the messenger itself.  The fiat exchange rates are collected from MOEX. There are seven default currencies in config: RUB, USD, EUR, GBP, CNY, JPY, INR. You can add others.  The cryptocurrencies exchange rates are gathered from Coinmarketcap.com. There are 26 by default, including ADM, BTC, ETH, XRP, DASH, LSK, DOGE. You can add others as well.  We plan to add other types of data in InfoService further.  Exchange rates in ADAMANT apps  The balances will appear in ADAMANT apps soon with an option to choose the currency to display them in.  If you want to use InfoService today, you can make the changes yourself ‚Äî see the API documentation.

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: Everything you wanted to know about forging (but were afraid to ask): delegates, pools, and votes  ADAMANT uses the Fair Delegate Proof-of-Stake consensus so that the process of gaining tokens differs from those of Bitcoin, Litecoin, DOGE and other Proof-of-Work currencies. If you have heard of that consensus before but thought it was complicated, this article can make it clear for you.    Forging: what to do?  1. Install an ADAMANT node (cloud service, 5$ per month), 2. Register a delegate (3000 ADM fee), 3. Support the delegate (200 000 ADM fee).  Top 101  Fair dPoS has a delegate ranking system, which depends on Vote Weight and Productivity. Only the first 101 delegates can forge and get a reward for supporting the network. Those delegates below the line cannot forge, even if their nodes function nonstop. The Vote Weight equals the sum of ADM in the voters‚Äô wallets.    Getting on the 101 list  1. Maintain your node‚Äôs activity 24/7, 2. Get other users‚Äô votes (they should have a sufficient amount of ADM).  If your node is down for half an hour or longer, you will not be on the list anymore. Additionally, you can lose your rank, if there are delegates with the greater Vote Weight.  Winning votes  Unfortunately, people do not have much motivation to vote for delegates right now. They do not get any reward for voting unless they came to terms with a delegate. However, it is still highly profitable to join a pool, as it distributes all the earnings automatically.  Consequently, many delegates vote for themselves (if they have 200 000 ADM). As the participants exploit ADM volatility and thus, make a solid profit, this support fee is constantly growing.  If you do not have that much ADM, do not worry. You can launch your own pool and invite participants at any time. Doing so will provide you with only a part of the earnings. Nevertheless, you will need just 3000 ADM to register a delegate. Technically, pools and delegates are the same things. If you want to learn more, have a look at this article.    Giving votes  If you want to vote for a pool or your delegate, open ADAMANT PWA. Go the ‚ÄúSettings‚Äù section and find the ‚ÄúVote for delegate‚Äù option. After that, you will have to look for a delegate or a pool in the list, tick the checkbox and push the ‚ÄúVote‚Äù button. Mind that voting costs 50 ADM.  Consequently, you can convert ADM to fiat currency. Please mind that as soon as you run out of tokens, you will not get profit anymore.    Voting for more than just one pool or delegate will result in getting only a half of the potential profit, as your votes are distributed equally between everyone you give votes for. Consequently, joining two pools at once will not double your income.  Downvoting: pros and cons  Downvoting costs 50 ADM, too. This is a specific feature of the blockchain system: both of the actions are equal to it. Indeed, if you give a vote mistakenly or decide to leave a pool, you may want to take back your vote.  However, there is a way to save these tokens. You can move your ADM to a new wallet and use it to downvote.  Forging pool: your bread and butter  Each payment schedule is unique. You can always check yours on a pool‚Äôs page. Moreover, we post an up-to-date pool catalog via ADAMANT social media every month.  Presently, the majority of payments and payroll management are accounted via a custom ADAMANT Tech Labs LP software. This software makes a transaction automatically, as soon as the minimum amount of earnings is gained. You can see this sum on a pool‚Äôs page. Additionally, a table below the pool‚Äôs page contains information on your deposit.

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: Oh wow, such DOGE  Back in December 2018, the ADAMANT team introduced DOGE to its customers. The development team employed storing and sending functions, which made interactions with Dogecoin possible. From now on, iOS users can join in the DOGE community due to recent ADAMANT updates.  Dogecoin came to the peak and made a handsome fortune worth $330 million in 2019. Its formula of success consists of various advantages such as low-cost transactions, lucrative emission, and great mining opportunities. At this very moment, $119 trillion are circulating in both the DOGE system and global net. Though contemplated as a Litecoin fork, Dogecoin made its own name thanks to efficient marketing and great functionality. Do not let the Internet meme dog confuse you; if anything, it is much more than just a cute puppy. DOGE provides people with a unique charity tool and has already built a tight-knit community. There are many people who support DOGE and ADAMANT is happy to contribute to this project, too. ADAMANT Messenger 1.5 for iOS allows sending and storing Dogecoin as well as tracking its balance in the ‚ÄúAcountt‚Äù section. What‚Äôs more, iOS users can now check on their transaction history regularly.   Dogecoin is the fourth cryptocurrency that was integrated into the ADAMANT iOS version. Speaking of, the first three currencies that became available for Apple users are ADM (the project‚Äôs token), ETH (Ethereum) and LSK (Lisk). At the moment, PWA ADAMANT represents six tokens. ADAMANT‚Äôs priorities are data safety and anonymity. To that end, the ADAMANT team employed DOGE support with these concepts in mind. An access key is not transferred over the network so that a wallet holder has total control over their account.

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: ADAMANT is asking for your support  We run out of money.  We‚Äôve been working on this project for two years, and our experience has shown that decentralized messenger is a real thing: World‚Äôs first blockchain storing your messages securely is up and running; 57,000 accounts created and 200,000 transactions made; New Fair DPoS consensus has shown its efficiency; Blockchain exceeds traditional messengers in security and privacy; The messenger has iOS, Android and web versions; Blockchain messenger has wide application ‚Äî see ADAMANT two-factor authentication (2FA) method; Cryptocurrency transfers available in chats.  We didn‚Äôt waste these two years. But all this work wasn‚Äôt enough, and now we have no money to continue the project. 25 team members worked in the ADAMANT team (apart from freelancers), and 15 of them were developers. Look at our GitHub, lots of code there! If you guess that decentralization is a right way for messaging, please support us.  Make donations  Bitcoin: 1NJKJDUhPVYTLWhE7DXm6a3g7PqhsacaMz Bitcoin Cash: qqzyy88lxqhf6cnc722wzfyfwhnzu8qtdqgr07grg2 Ethereum: 0x5f66C2FbA4dd54758b7243d3e181100aA4154ae8 ADAMANT: U1973842998847463129  Buy tokens  Buy ADM tokens on our website with BTC, ETH, LTC, DOGE, DASH or LSK.  Contribute your own  Maybe you can publish an article about ADAMANT in some respected media? Or help ADM to get listed on a large cryptocurrency exchange? We‚Äôd appreciate any assistance you could offer.  ADAMANT Foundation  We‚Äôre also planning to establish the ADAMANT Foundation which will raise funds and organize and sponsor the development of ADAMANT Messenger. ADAMANT Foundation is an alternative way to continue the development. If we‚Äôll not receive donations, external developers will do the work. ADAMANT Foundation will create tasks and pay rewards to freelancers for their accomplishments. We have agreements with some of investors to transfer ADM tokens to ADAMANT Foundation.  And if that doesn't work?  No big deal. We‚Äôd just postpone our work until the next rising of the crypto world. Maybe some big IT company would be able to use our experience to make their own decentralized messenger.  The best is yet to come.

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: How was the first ADM forging pool born: the founders‚Äô story  ADAMANT Messenger has a strong supportive community that believes in our project‚Äôs potential. Therefore the first ADM forging pool happened to be an unofficial one, created by messenger users at the end of last year. The adm_official_pool appeared in a few weeks later. While more and more people are taking interest in the project, let us recap how it all began.  The cost of creating a delegate in the ADAMANT ecosystem is 3000 ADM, but it is also necessary to pay a sufficient number of votes for it: to earn income from forging the delegate must not fall below 101 first positions in the overall rating. Currently the ‚Äústarting capital‚Äù is about 5000 ADM.  The first pool was founded by two enthusiasts who had enough tokens for the delegate creation but did not have enough votes. They decided to team up with other ADM owners in order to earn money by forging.  Having received the project developers‚Äô consent, the activists started their Telegram chat ADAMANT FORGING (https://t.me/adamant_forging). There they were discussing forging issues and gathering new people. The price for delegate creation was paid by the two founders themselves: this increased the trust of other participants. That way the risk of joining the pool was minimal because the participants gave only their own votes. At first only people with small amounts of ADM were coming (mind that the total number of tokens amongst all voters affects the forging efficiency). Then larger capitals appeared and the pool was complete in just two days.  Note that there are no technical restrictions on the number of participants, and we welcome everyone to the official pool. However, the founders of the first community decided to close the pool on a certain number of participants for ease of management.  ‚ÄúWe didn‚Äôt even have enough time to find a hosting,‚Äù recalls Stas Kuznetsov, one of the enthusiasts. ‚ÄúWe thought we had a week so it was necessary to speed up and find it as soon as possible‚Äù.  Now several ‚Äúunofficial‚Äù ADAMANT pools are up paying their members in manual or automatic mode. And there is the official pool which automatically distributes the reward every 10 days.  Want to found your own pool? This is easy to do with a free reward calculation program from ADAMANT Tech Labs LP! You can ask questions to the developers in the comments section there.

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: We have recently finished working on a software that simplifies the forging pools‚Äô performance greatly. Notably, this software reduces the pool‚Äôs holder involvement and makes the process of registration of a new group delegate much easier.  Moreover, we developed a friendly interface that collects and displays pools‚Äô statistics. ‚ÄúPay in Coins‚Äù and ‚ÄúDutch Pool‚Äù, our partners, have already tested this brand new software, launched their forging pools and web pages to display statistics:  http://142.93.36.183:36668 and http://adamant_dutchpool.thamar.net:36668. Comparing to the ADAMANT official forging pool, these two distribute tokens between the voters more frequently. Moreover, their rate of interest differs from the official pool. That is to say, supporting the ‚ÄúDutch Pool‚Äù delegate costs about 10% of total ADM income. If you wish to support the ‚ÄúPay in Coins‚Äù delegate, you will have to give 15% of earned ADM (payincoins_admpool). To give an illustration, the official ADAMANT delegate requires about 20% of forged tokens (adm_official_pool). Consequently, we may say that this is a good example of the decentralized system, which encourages competition and functions for the sake of a more convenient and secure environment. Due to initiative ground support, we welcome a public range of influence that functions within the Fair dPoS consensus algorithm.  In conclusion, we must point out that this phenomenon prevents network monopolization and encourages the crypto community to express their opinions effectively and share the experience.

Remember that the more pools you upvote, the smaller your voting weight=earnings you get from a single pool. Body: Opening ADM/USDT trading pair on Bit-Z  ADM is a utility token supporting decentralized ADAMANT Messenger infrastructure. Due to ADM token, ADAMANT is independent from governments, corporations and even developers.  As a result of the cooperation between ADAMANT and the Bit-Z exchange, you can buy and sell ADM tokens as well as transfer ADM and BZ in ADAMANT Messenger chats.  Those who want to buy ADM anonymously, can still do this in the relevant webpage on the official project website.  ADAMANT is a blockchain platform for secure messaging. ADAMANT Messenger uses the Fair dPoS consensus algorithm; the app does not require a phone number or email for signup and allows you to send cryptocurrencies in chats. ADAMANT Messenger is available on iOS and Android, as well as via browser.  Bit-Z is one of the leading digital asset trading platforms. At the time of this writing, Bit-Z ranks 2nd in the daily trading volume.  See also: Opening ADM / USDT trading pair announcement by Bit-Z exchange.  Bit-Z trading pair: ADM / USDT.

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: ADAMANT is working on a perfect 2FA solution  Usually, when people come across ‚Äútwo-factor authentication‚Äù, they think of emails, one-time passwords (OTPs) and SMS codes. In fact, two-factor authentication or 2FA means any way of enhancing security using not only passwords but other methods as well. The main goal of 2FA is adding extra protection to your account.  If you enter both a password and an OTP to log in your online bank account, this is 2FA. Other widespread examples such as fingerprint scans and screen patterns on smartphones, passwords and encryption keys for crypto marketing, are probably familiar to you as well.  2FA: look before you leap  In theory, all the mentioned above ways of securing sensitive information are quite solid. However, our expectations often differ from reality. That is to say, many up-to-date 2FA solutions have serious flaws.  The first flaw is the inconvenience. The more inputs the user makes to log in, the more cumbersome 2FA becomes. If there is a possibility to use an app or service without 2FA, people will likely do so. For instance, Google launched 2FA in 2011. However, less than 10% of consumers use it today. Forcing users to adopt the 2FA system is not an option, as they will probably just switch to a different and more convenient service.  The second flaw is the vulnerability. Many so-called ‚Äúsecond factors‚Äù can be phished. 2FA often inspires a certain trust in its methods, which makes people set weak passwords. In this case, cybercriminals can easily take over an account.  One of the most vulnerable second factors existing is an SMS verification code. NIST (National Institute of Standards and Technology) states that this security method is unsafe due to serious flaws in SS7 (Signaling System 7).  Many popular second factors have other disadvantages. It often takes time to receive an SMS or email with a verification code and sometimes you do not get one at all. If you lose your phone, you will not get access to your account (e.q. Google Authenticator system). Moreover, these second factors are often costly and unreliable. Not mentioning that some of them can be used on certain devices only.  Blockchain is the answer  The ADAMANT team develops an exceptional 2FA solution based on blockchain. It is a cheaper, safer and more solid option any other known security methods. ADAMANT messenger is an alternative to regular second factors.  With ADAMANT 2FA, you can use existing and well-tested libraries. The system works just the way you got used to it in other services, except that you will receive codes via ADAMANT messenger rather than SMS or emails.  The messages are encrypted, so that no third parties can take over, read or implement them. Code‚Äôs delivery is always verified in blockchain. Each code request is rated as a regular ADAMANT message and costs only 0.001 ADM (approx. 0.00025 USD). Moreover, you can receive a code via PC, tab, smartphone or laptop ‚Äì just make sure you are connected to the Internet (your service needs it anyway).  Have a look at the comparison chart below:    How it works  ADAMANT 2FA is suited for any Internet-related service, such as crypto exchanges, online-banks, and email. In order to activate 2FA, you need neither your phone number nor your personal information but an account‚Äôs identifier. As soon as you enter your identifier, you will receive a message in ADAMANT, containing a verification code. This will activate 2FA. Hereafter, you will get a verification code via ADAMANT messenger every time you wish to sign in this service.  In a while, ADAMANT 2FA‚Äôs components will be available in popular 2FA libraries on GitHub.  Get 2FA for free  If you are interested in the ADAMANT 2FA solution, we will be glad to help you and compensate tokens spent on sending verification codes.  This offer is limited, so do not hesitate to contact us in ADAMANT: U15677078342684640219 (msg.adamant.im).  ADAMANT TECH LABS is also looking for partners in other aspects of work: https://adamant.im/partners/

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: ADAMANT Messenger update for iOS ‚Äî ETH and ADM transactions in chats!  ADAMANT is not just a messenger ‚Äî we strive to create a multifunctional system for personal and business communication. One of our goals is to implement means for instant exchange of cryptocurrencies and tokens in chats, and we successfully implemented it in the latest versions of our apps. We present you an update of ADAMANT Messenger for iOS: the app now works approximately 33 times faster and users can send ADM and ETH to each other.  Fast, convenient, accurate  We‚Äôve already implemented the sending of our own tokens (ADM) in the progressive web app (PWA) as well as ETH and Binance Coin (BNB). You can send all three of them wallet-to-wallet as well as right in chats. This feature successfully passed all tests and received a positive feedback.  Now Apple device users can also send tokens via ADAMANT Messenger as we added sending of ADM and ETH in chats in the latest update for iOS.  The main advantage of this feature is its simplicity: you just use a regular messenger‚Äôs interface to send and receive transactions. In the Wallet section, you can withdraw your tokens to an external wallet. Since you can rename your contacts and have your own ‚Äúaddress book‚Äù, you are safe from mistakes when typing a receiver‚Äôs address.  Therefore this feature allows you to pay for goods and services in one click as well as instantly send tokens and currencies to your friends and partners. The fee for transactions in ADAMANT is 100 lower than in banks; sending ETH to any place on the planet costs 0.0004 ETH (~6 cents at the time of this writing).  New code ‚Äî new speed  Besides new types of transactions, this iOS update has another important feat. Our development team has rewritten JavaScript code to native Swift, and this allowed ~33 times faster loading and decrypting speed. We worked hard during these three months to release this update, and now proudly present the results.  You can download ADAMANT Messenger for iOS in App Store.  People trust ADAMANT because the source code is completely public.  What‚Äôs next?  We plan to expand the messenger‚Äôs features further: implement new tokens and cryptocurrencies transfers and other options. The updated will be focused on sending and receiving Lisk tokens in chats.  Subscribe to our Medium to keep up with updates.

Body: ADAMANT TECH LABS developers team represented updates for ADAMANT Node. Version 0.4.2 is already available for installation. This is an important step of development.  We standardized API for sending transactions, there is now one point for sending all kinds of transaction to the network. We redesigned tests that ensure stability of future updates. We also upgraded Sodium encryption library for compatibility with NodeJS ‚Äò last versions.  Details: - New POST /api/transactions endpoint for receiving any transaction - Unit-tests fixed - API-tests fixed - API-test added for ADAMANT features - New option ‚Äúfasttest‚Äù for tests that skip slow tests - Updated Sodium dependency to resolve problems with recent Node.js versions  It isn‚Äôt necessarily to update your node, because this release doesn‚Äôt play a role in forging or network‚Äôs functioning.  Release of ADAMANT Node 0.4.2: https://github.com/Adamant-im/adamant/releases/tag/v0.4.2

Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: In-chat transfers for Binance Coin is now supported  In June ADAMANT Team had finished integration of Ether transfers In-Chat (https://medium.com/adamant-im/in-chat-transfers-for-ethereum-and-adamant-tokens-are-now-supported-69bd1256f2a5), and that was only a first step. Moving through the Roadmap, we‚Äôre happy to announce that the ADAMANT Messenger platform now supports in-chat Binance Coin transfers.  As well as in case of Ether transfers, BNB transfers are user-friendly and convenient. This simplistic feature should benefit even friends and relatives looking to send and receive secure and instant payments.  Absolutely Secure  Binance Coin support in ADAMANT Messenger is implemented with the same principles as Ethereum support ‚Äî using this feature is completely secure, only you own your wallets in your ADAMANT account. Read the explanation here: https://medium.com/adamant-im/adamant-messenger-secure-eth-transfers-b27984a3ce05.  Security is our top priority, so not long ago we‚Äôve finished internal security audit and run First Security Contest https://adamant.im/1securitycontest/. An independent security audit will be the next step.  Read more:  https://medium.com/adamant-im/in-chat-transfers-for-binance-coin-is-now-supported-3b494b812e62

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: We postpone the date of listing ADM on exchanges to the 4th quarter of 2018  The reason is simple ‚Äî currently we consider the listing on exchange to be rather negative than positive thing. This is fair for our users and investors, and for the project as a whole.  We have the opportunity to be listed now; currently ADAMANT has more than 10 offers from the top 100 Coinmarketcap exchanges, and the price for listing of our project starts at 0.2 BTC. We are still receiving offers and choosing the best ones. The listing ‚Äúon some exchange‚Äù right now won‚Äôt bring any good to the project. Considering the recent general downfall on the cryptocurrency market, we can expect the ADM token‚Äôs price to go down if volumes are low. More than 95% tokens turned out to be unprofitable (considering the ICO price) according to icodrops.com/ico-stats data.  There is also a technical reason for the setback ‚Äî ADM is not ERC20 token, and that makes the integration harder; many exchanges request a lot of additional juridical information.  The listing delay will affect all ADM token holders in a positive way. ADAMANT is one of rare examples where blockchain has real application. The team is constantly expanding: now we have 15 developers, and the messenger is actively gaining new features (see the recent support of Binance Coin transfers). We have enough money to continue development. There were over 100,000 created accounts. The Team is going to find new partners and investors before the listing and get even more users that way.  All this will positively affect the volumes and ADM token‚Äôs starting price in 4th quarter of 2018.  Of course, being behind the roadmap is unpleasant, but we first take into account the interests of investors and stability of the product and its development.

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: ADAMANT team met security experts on the last meetup  Hi everybody!  Today we'll tell you about ADAMANT's meetup in September. We met world-known cybersecurity experts of Defence Group in Moscow City business center. Together we discussed possible vulnerabilities of ADAMANT as well as various topics on privacy and security.  If you follow us here on Medium, you already know that our team is distributed: many of our employees work remotely from different cities and even countries. We all share common virtual space but sometimes have live meetups as well where we get to know each other and have discussions. Each meetup is very unique since challenges are becoming more complex due to constant evolution of the project and expanding of our team.    September meetup represented a new phase for us. We discussed a lot of cybersecurity issues and conducted an audit of ADAMANT.  ADAMANT is a highly secure messenger  The cybersecurity tests are in process ‚Äî we‚Äôre running our first security contest since the inner audit is successfully completed and now we need third party audits.  The experts noted some advantages of ADAMANT Messenger such as no phone number for ¬´restoring access¬ª. We also discussed typical vulnerabilities of popular messengers and target audience of high privacy and security services.   Meeting in Defence Group‚Äôs office. Moscow City, business center ‚ÄúCapital City‚Äù  Roadmap update  On the second day of meetup our team discussed phases of development according to ADAMANT's roadmap.    Our major achievements in September are integration of Binance Coin into the transactions system and cooperation with regional representatives in Germany. We also did a lot of other work which might not be visible for our end-users but is definitely good for the future.      September ¬´Done¬ª list:  * Tests coverage for ADAMANT nodes; * Research on Lisk updates. Backporting critical updates; * Monitoring and notifications on system failures; * Running security tests; * Code reviews on security issues; * First Security Contest; * PWA: Transition to Vue 3.0; * PWA: Transition to IndexedDB; * PWA: Integration with Binance Coin; * Lookup for international conferences; * Contact authors of messengers comparisons articles; * Find regional representatives (Germany); * Apply for fiat processing account; * Design Guidelines; * 1-pager design; * Merchandising; *Translations updates.  Development plan:  Blockchain        * API for optimal work with chats and peers, bootstrap, address book and other KVS records; write APIs for standardization; * Research on Group chats and Closable chats; * Research on storage of files on the nodes; * Multiple tests of ADAMANT current features; * Append APIs; * Documentation for exchanges.  Infrastructure  * Nodes for Ethereum (ERC-20), Lisk, Bitcoin, DOGE with indexes; * ADAMANT 2FA solution; * Creating ADM forging pool service; * Monitoring and notifications on system failures (services part); * Running security tests (other services).  Progressive Web Application     * Transition to Vuetify; * UI responsiveness improvement; * Moving to new API and pagination; * Health check; * Integration with ERC20-tokens. GitHub repository for ERC20-tokens list; * Transaction list for Ethereum and ERC20-tokens; * Tokens list design update; * Fast UX for sending payments in-chat; * Notifications improvements; * Optional login by password with secure on-device storage; * First release of Electron version of the PWA application; * Releasing the app (Electron) on Windows Store; * Releasing the app (Electron) on Mac App Store; * QR-codes functionality; * Integration with DOGE; in-chat payments with DOGE.      iOS     * Integration with Ethereum (storing and transferring of Ethereum); * Integration with Lisk (storing and transferring of Lisk); * iPad app adjustments; * Multi-accounts; * Welcome screen on app launch (5-pager for understanding what ADAMANT is); * Transition to the new API for bootstrap and contact list, KVS; * Search through messages; *Themes (dark theme); * Avatar images generation.  Android  * First version of Material Design 2.0 app; * Test app in Google Play.  Marketing and PR  *Planning and visiting new conferences; * Posts about ADAMANT Messenger on security forums and communities; * Article on security of popular messengers, its translation and promotion; * Find more regional representatives.     Administrative  * Partnership with an information security company.  Design and Website  * Explorer redesign; * Nice and clean video about ADAMANT.

Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: ADAMANT Messenger Roadmap Update  The ADAMANT project was launched in early 2017. During this time, a phenomenal amount of work has been completed. There are no signs of slowing down ‚Äî this is only the beginning. Our team has consistently conducted meetups & collaborations in-order to discuss detailed plans that achieve complete privacy protection for our users. We actively respond to community feedback and have adjusted the Roadmap for our project. Our new Roadmap includes a variety of your queries, including group and deletable chats, and features for securely sending files and images. https://adamant.im/#roadmap

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: While working on the ADAMANT Messenger, we‚Äôve been collecting user questions about security, and how the messenger is different from other. ADAMANT Messenger is the first and only instant messenger that works entirely via blockchain and this allows us to reach a higher level of security and confidentiality which is inaccessible for other messengers. People always meet new things with criticism, irritation, criticism. We are sure that messengers built on blockchain will find their place and importance in the world. ADAMANT is just the beginning of a difficult and long path of change. We collected information about security in ADAMANT here for you to read: https://medium.com/adamant-im/adamant-security-features-e7cc836ff52c

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: ADAMANT Security Contest ‚Äî 40 ETH  The ADAMANT TECH LABS LP team already audited security internally and are now preparing for independent security audits in accordance with the roadmap. With this in-mind,  We‚Äôre launching the First Contest on breaking the ADAMANT Messenger‚Äôs security with a 30 ETH bounty, and additional contest with a 10 ETH bounty  Unlike the "classic" security contests where you are offered to decrypt encrypted messages (pointless!), we give you full access to the entire ADAMANT infrastructure‚Äîthe blockchain is fully accessible from the moment of its launch. Deploy your node and the messenger app locally, dive into the source code. We are aware that on the one hand such openness makes the project highly vulnerable to attacks, but on the other we are convinced that this is the only way to create a truly secure messenger‚Äîby joining efforts with information security experts.  Read more and Join the ADAMANT Security contest now! https://adamant.im/1securitycontest/

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: The ADAMANT blockchain nodes have been updated to version 0.4.0, introducing the Fair Delegate System. Important! You need to update your nodes. The ADAMANT team implemented the Fair Delegate System https://medium.com/adamant-im/fair-delegate-system-in-dpos-568e5c3c86c8, also adding to the calculation of the Vote weight the Productivity of a delegate. Faster nodes that do not miss blocks will have higher Vote Weight. Also fixed an error, when the nodes get stuck on the block 4078586. Attention! This update is mandatory for installation on all nodes of the network, including those which includes no delegates. Changes come into force from block 4359464, approximately on Friday, August, 3rd. In another 2 days, all nodes on the version below 0.4.0 will be rejected by the network. See the release details: https://github.com/Adamant-im/adamant/releases/tag/v0.4.0

Body: Fair dPoS Delegate System goes live! Join Channel for delegates to discuss ADAMANT plans  We are happy to announce that Fair dPoS Delegate System successfully works now, and delegates list was reordered. New Rank system considers the Node Productivity and Number of user‚Äôs votes. Final formula for Vote weight is: Vote weight = ADM / Votes * Productivity See the explanation: https://medium.com/adamant-im/fair-delegate-system-in-dpos-568e5c3c86c8 Attention! All nodes on the version below 0.4.0 now rejected by the network, so please update your node, if you haven‚Äôt done it earlier. Slack channel for delegates to discuss ADAMANT plans Decentralization is the basis for any blockchain. We want not only to increase the number of delegates for the network, but also to get your opinion on the future of ADAMANT. Especially for this purpose we created a Slack channel. Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: What is ‚ÄòKey-Value Store‚Äô in ADAMANT and How Is It Used to Store Contact Names?  Earlier, we announced the development of a new mechanism for storing contact data (KVS) in blockchain and a new transaction type, we have already implemented these innovations in the ADAMANT Blockchain version 0.2.0. KVS (key-value store) is a way to store information, both public and private (secure), where examples are public Ethereum addresses and private Address books. Now, we‚Äôve updated the Messenger application to version 1.4.0, so you‚Äôre now able to use new functionality ‚Äî to rename a contact, click a header with the ADAMANT address in-chat. Also ‚Äî many small improvements and fixes. Try it yourself: msg.adamant.im. Make sure you are using the latest version of the application (settings tab at the bottom). Clear your browser‚Äôs cache if this is not the case.  More information is in our GitHub: https://github.com/Adamant-im/adamant-im/releases/tag/v1.4.0

Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: Fair Delegate System in dPoS  After publishing the article ‚ÄúDPoS Explained‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäSimply‚Äù, and giving instructions on node deployment, we have received an extensive array of feedback from the community and delegates in-regards to the ADAMANT network. Since decentralization is a critical attribute of ADAMANT, our team has assessed the possible improvements within the system, quiet specifically the experience of our fellow Lisk colleagues. How much do you consider Lisk to be decentralized? To become a Lisk delegate, you must attain 29 million tokens worth of votes ‚Äî this is currently equal to 145,000,000 USD in LSK tokens. Furthermore, over 1,600 delegates in the Lisk Network have been forever suspended into Standby mode.  Read full artice: https://medium.com/adamant-im/fair-delegate-system-in-dpos-568e5c3c86c8

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: Good afternoon! Thank you for your interest in the project. You can put our application on the phone, until the end of July it will be free to download in Appstore. Now you can go to our official site https://adamant.im and try the beta version of the applications (IOS, Android), you can also try the web version of https://msg.adamant.im from your computer. If you have Android then the web version can be used as an application on the phone by placing an icon on the desktop. Concerning the translation of ETH. When creating an account, you have a wallet number, and an ETH wallet is also created. If your friend creates a wallet Adamant, he will have the same. To send him an ETH, you only need to know the number of your friend's ADAMANT wallet. Also you can write a message to a friend. Messages are encrypted and no one can read them. Then right in the chat there is a function - send ETH. For this, of course, you need a certain amount of ETH. You can send it there from your wallet, as you usually do. ADAMANT can be used for storage as a multi-currency wallet. Soon we will connect BTC, Lisk and many other currencies. Also you can write a message to a friend. Messages are encrypted and no one can read them.

Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: Successful completion of ICO  The ADAMANT Messenger project launched in April 2017 with just an idea. Step-by-step, our technical concept was born, the architecture of the system, the blockchain network, the company registration, the applications, and now, ADAMANT is the only single-messenger operating entirely via a blockchain, providing a secure and anonymous platform for online messaging. ADAMANT is unique ‚Äî Previously implemented, the transmission feature of Ethereum transfers in-chat. On this note, we will continue to expand the capabilities of our messenger! All of this has become possible due to the diligent work efforts of professionals in our team, as well as the overwhelmingly positive support of our users! Fundraising has been successfully completed. Thank you to everyone who supported our project!  What‚Äôs next? We will continue active development of the ADAMANT Messenger. The ADM token is planned to enter exchanges during the third quarter of 2018.

The ADAMANT Messenger platform now supports in-chat Ether transfers. We have made Ether transfers user-friendly and convenient, any user on the platform can now pay for goods and services directly in ETH. This simplistic feature should benefit even friends and relatives looking to send and receive secure, instant-payments with each other. There is incredible potential benefit for this feature, as a platform for communications and financial transactions, sellers looking for the sales of personal goods and services can choose ADAMANT as a private-platform for communication with their buyers. Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: The ADAMANT team is a team of developers, and we‚Äôre proud of it.  The modern world is ruled by marketing and PR. Many companies are working just to create a fake present wrapping with big, broken promises.  In the team's opinion, our priority is the product itself. The ADAMANT team is working to preserve your privacy and rights for personal space. The ADAMANT messenger implements a fundamentally new approach to messaging, a very difficult task, from more than just the technical side. We are going against the conventional current ‚Äî people do not like change, people hate change, people are afraid of change. But every-day, step-by-step, the line of code by line of code, our new system is being born. And it does not matter whether this project is successful or not, because there is no success without perseverance.  The ADAMANT team is a team of developers, and we‚Äôre proud of it.  https://adamant.im/#adm-team

Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: Push notifications for ADAMANT Messenger for iOS and ready for Apple Store  Earlier we‚Äôve told we are working on Blockchain messaging platform and Push notifications Service: https://medium.com/adamant-im/adamant-is-working-on-blockchain-messaging-platform-and-push-notifications-service-765972cce50e It is ready and released! Meet new application update for iOS, which introduces convenience of Push notifications. The Blockchain in ADAMANT serves as an immersive distributed storage of connected transactions protected by cryptographic encryption methods that creates immutability over time. The access to this storage is open to the ADAMANT Services system that is implemented by independent developers, giving users additional options. To install an update just open the TestFlight app. If you haven‚Äôt installed the messenger earlier, see adamant.im/adamant-messenger-for-ios. Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: After almost a year since the beginning of ADAMANT‚Äôs full-scale, rapid development, our team has completed a large number of seemingly impossible tasks. Undoubtedly, all of the implemented elements of this complex system and the users who share our values, support the unquenchable thirst of our desires and aspirations, pushing the project further every day towards our new, seemingly unattainable goals. Today, we would like to thank every user and supporter of our project for their clear, unchanging views on how to exchange information. Keeping your views persistent, opposing the conventional models of messengers, gives a strong and reliable foundation for the construction of our ADAMANT platform and its capabilities. The belief in an idea from a small group of individuals has always been able to change the world. Currently, the source-code of the ADAMANT network is actively being developed, the messenger's functions are expanding, and the visual appearance on all platforms is improving. A lot of work is being done, including minor details that are no less important to all users. Anyone can observe the development with each update on the ADAMANT Messenger. We will continue to please you all with upcoming announcements and releases. All of these updates are big steps in the development of the entire project and its ideas. We would like to again thank everyone personally for demonstrating their position and enthusiasm, as we continue to work diligently on our project, expanding the ADAMANT team of professionals and erasing the obstacles ahead. Thank you! ADAMANT Messenger team

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: ETH wallet in ADAMANT Messenger  Blockchain technology enters closely into our life making it more convenient! As we said earlier, ADAMANT team is working on transferring tokens (ADM, ETH, BTC, LSK, etc.) right in chats. With the release 1.1.0 of the app an ETH-wallet is created automatically for each user ‚Äî this is a step towards the more ambitious goal. We followed the path of greatest security by never storing or transferring private keys for these ETH-wallets over the network since their generation is based on ADAMANT passphrase. Roughly speaking, this works the same way as MyEtherWallet does; soon we will explain everything in detail. Try it yourself: msg.adamant.im. Make sure you are using the latest version of the application (settings tab at the bottom). Clear your browser‚Äôs cache if this is not the case.  More information is in our GitHub:  https://github.com/Adamant-im/adamant-im/releases/tag/v1.1.0

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: Not long ago it turned out that Facebook was scanning messages sent via its Messenger app. The company said that it scans messages only for abuse, however, we all remember that Google used to read personal emails for better ads personalization. Another popular Telegram messenger is experiencing pressure from authorities in different countries who would like to get an opportunity to read what users are writing in chats. Seems that nowadays it is almost impossible to use any convenient communication without completely sacrificing privacy. Let‚Äôs talk about how this could be fixed: https://hackernoon.com/messenger-problem-why-secure-does-not-mean-private-and-how-to-fix-this-with-blockchain-e5467f410201

The problem of information asymmetries arises over and over again because user agreements have been normalized to be corporation-friendly, not reader-friendly. The agreements are notoriously opaque and present take-it-or-leave-it offers that deprive consumers of bargaining power.‚Äù  ‚Äî Read further: Facebook Fabricates Trust Through Fake Intimacy https://medium.com/s/trustissues/facebook-fabricates-trust-through-fake-intimacy-b381e60d32f9

Author: ttookk
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: Hey, sorry for being annoying, but what is Adamant's stance on metadata? For now, while the message itself is encrypted, it is very visible which addresses interact with each other. Are there plans to change this in the future?  It could be possible to have a type of "super-stealth message", where it is visible that a message was sent, but not to whom.  The system would be quite simple: omit the receiving address completely. The receive will download all new blocks and just go through all transaction, trying to decrypt them. If they have the private key, they will be able to successfully decrypt the message addressed at them, if not, nothing happens.  This would solve quite a few problems:  - Someone watching traffic and the blockchain can only see that an address sent a message, but not to whom.  - Since the receiving party is forced to download complete blocks*, a spy cannot conclusively link sender and receiver together.  *Of course, this has it's holes as well. For example, if I watch an entity downloading blocks and they suddenly stop, I can safely assume that the message directed at them was in the last few blocks. This problem is amplified by Adamants extremely short block times, especially when few people are using the system. One solution would be to have the clients always sync completely, no matter what, but this could still make correlations visible. Another solution could be to have dedicated "super-stealth blocks", meaning, "super-stealth-messages" are collected over a certain time and are written in a block that occurs every few hours, or maybe even only once a day. After all, the bigger the pool of messages, the harder it is to link two entities. This solution would obviously hve the problem, that an attacker could fill the super-stealth blocks in a way, that all but a few messages in the block belong to them. The few remaining can be correlated to the receiver, if they only download up to a certain block height.  Still, I think decoupling theye parts, somewhat making the metadate as inconclusive as possible is important for a good privacy focussed messenger.

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: We've thought about it, yes.   It could be possible to have a type of "super-stealth message", where it is visible that a message was sent, but not to whom.   It is one of alternatives.    The system would be quite simple: omit the receiving address completely. The receive will download all new blocks and just go through all transaction, trying to decrypt them. If they have the private key, they will be able to successfully decrypt the message addressed at them, if not, nothing happens.  This would solve quite a few problems:  - Someone watching traffic and the blockchain can only see that an address sent a message, but not to whom.  - Since the receiving party is forced to download complete blocks*, a spy cannot conclusively link sender and receiver together.  *Of course, this has it's holes as well. For example, if I watch an entity downloading blocks and they suddenly stop, I can safely assume that the message directed at them was in the last few blocks. This problem is amplified by Adamants extremely short block times, especially when few people are using the system. One solution would be to have the clients always sync completely, no matter what, but this could still make correlations visible. Another solution could be to have dedicated "super-stealth blocks", meaning, "super-stealth-messages" are collected over a certain time and are written in a block that occurs every few hours, or maybe even only once a day. After all, the bigger the pool of messages, the harder it is to link two entities. This solution would obviously hve the problem, that an attacker could fill the super-stealth blocks in a way, that all but a few messages in the block belong to them. The few remaining can be correlated to the receiver, if they only download up to a certain block height.  Still, I think decoupling theye parts, somewhat making the metadate as inconclusive as possible is important for a good privacy focussed messenger.   ADAMANT is the first one real blockchain messenger. So what we did it testes the concept. All the sweets will be later.

Body: ADAMANT Messenger Makes Privacy A Reality  Do you value private conversation? Perhaps you need to relay some sensitive information to a business associate across the globe and need to know that your discussion won‚Äôt be exposed to a third party. ADAMANT Messenger uses encryption and decryption methods to hide your data completely within the blockchain. A simple-to-use, web-based service for any device. Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: Showing token transfers in Chats Blockchain technology enters closely into our life, making it more convenient! As we said earlier, ADAMANT is working on transferring tokens (ADM, ETH, BTC, LSK, etc.) right in chats. With the release of the application 1.0.28, ADM transfers are displayed in chats ‚Äî this is a step towards implementing a more ambitious goal. Try it yourself: https://msg.adamant.im. Make sure you are using the latest version of the application (Settings tab, at the bottom). If this is not the case, clear the browser's cache. More information about the release is in our GitHub: https://github.com/Adamant-im/adamant-im/releases/tag/v1.0.28

Author: Azza1070
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: If you purchase tokens through a website that monitors your details (most general exchanges/exchange-markets) then yes, the link to your identity is known. However, if you purchase cryptocurrencies anonymously, or purchase them from a monitored exchange and then trade them for a coin that has absolute privacy (Monero, Zcash, PIVX, etc), then the link with your identity is broken, as long as you stay off exchanges that can track your identity (after that point).  For example: If you purchase 1 ETH on CoinBase, your details are monitored everywhere you send that ETH. If you send your 1 ETH to a decentralized exchange (such as: Gate.io), and swap your ETH for Monero. You can now send your Monero anonymously to another exchange or website (that does not monitor details) and your identity cannot be known (depending on the website/exchange). If the ADM token could be exchanged directly for Monero (XMR), then there is no possible way to track your identity, and thus you can purchase ADM tokens anonymously in this way. A good strategy for the ADAMANT team would be to get the ADM token listed on as many decentralized exchanges as possible, or to create a decentralized token-swapping feature. Lead Devs might know more on this.  Quote from: vlom on May 14, 2018, 04:59:02 PM how to become a delegate? its a lisk clone?  https://github.com/Adamant-im/adamant only show the installation.  setting up a delegate is not explained. voting?  thanks for the help.  Yes, the ADAMANT platform is built on a forked-Lisk codebase. The delegate feature should be available shortly, I believe the question on whether staking and voting will be introduced was answered in the English Telegram group about 2 weeks ago, with a rough estimation being 2-3 weeks (1 more week from now). A Lead Dev should be able to answer this question in more detail.  Details on how to set-up a delegate will be explained once the feature is available.

Author: Azza1070
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: Hi Jones, thank you for your comment, it means a lot to us. We're happy to answer all questions informatively.   1. So Genesis is 98 million, how the rest of the coins - 102million will be distributed? Page 21 of the ADAMANT Whitepaper (https://adamant.im/whitepaper/adamant-whitepaper-en.pdf): "102 millions of ADM tokens (+ transaction fees) will be used to payback the delegate members for infrastructure support and maintaining the network functional. To learn more on the forging rewards ‚Äî please read the ‚ÄúInfrastructure maintaining and ADM token forging (mining)‚Äù section of this original document."   2. Is this Dpos blockchain, if so how look the inflation and for how long? The ADAMANT Blockchain is based on DPoS. See Page 12 of the ADAMANT Whitepaper (https://adamant.im/whitepaper/adamant-whitepaper-en.pdf) for more details: Token name: ADAMANT (ADM) ‚óè DPoS algorithm (Delegated Proof of Stake) ‚óè Maximum tokens amount: 200 000 000 ADM ‚óè Genesis-block: 98 000 000 ADM ‚óè Block time: 5 seconds (17 280 blocks per day, about 6 307 200 blocks per year) ‚óè Block size: variative (not limited) ‚óè Reward per block: ‚óã First year: 0.5 ADM per block ‚óã Another years: decreasing by 0.01 ADM every year till fit 0.1 ADM ‚óã Rewards start from: block number 2,000,000   3. how many delegates will secure the blockchain - delegates will be more like lisk or more ark? Page 14 of the ADAMANT Whitepaper (https://adamant.im/whitepaper/adamant-whitepaper-en.pdf): "The number of active delegates participating in blocks forging is 101. In case when their number is lower than that, these 101 votes will be allocated among the existing members which operate as a full node. The minimum amount of such nodes is 3. The whole system becomes more stable and reliable with the amount of nodes increasing."   4. most important I think - what is the use case for the coins? Page 21 of the ADAMANT Whitepaper (https://adamant.im/whitepaper/adamant-whitepaper-en.pdf): ADM is a token, which value is ensured by commissions (fees) for message and data transfer. These fees are designed to fully cover all infrastructure cost dictated by the needs for anonymous and secure data transmission. ADAMANT Business Service also includes digital document signing (approving) features. There is an additional ADM value that is produced through the distribution process of all remainings of the unsold tokens which were allocated for the ICO campaign. This process is named ‚ÄúADAMANT Grows‚Äù and users that have enough ADM tokens within their wallet balances will receive proportionally monthly rewards for the approximate period of a one year after the ICO ends up.

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: The ADAMANT team is currently working on the Blockchain-messaging platform and an update that includes a Push-notifications Service.    ADAMANT Messenger is far more than a digital messenger, we‚Äôre creating an entire blockchain-based communication platform. The Blockchain in ADAMANT serves as an immersive distributed storage of connected transactions protected by cryptographic encryption methods that creates immutability over time. The access to this storage is open to the ADAMANT Services system that is implemented by independent developers, giving users additional options.    These services will connect to the blockchain, and user apps ‚Äî to a service. These services are various, for example, ADAMANT developers implemented the instant-notification service (Push Notifications): github.com/Adamant-im/AdamantNotificationService. This service does not only provide convenience but also saves battery power. See how it works: https://youtu.be/WK3gyH7_iAw. Our team is working on connecting the Push Notification Service to the iOS application, and then transferring it to other platforms. Together to the future of messaging!

Author: jujubax
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: I think that the assumption of 300 bytes per message is not very precise, because you also have to store sender and receiver addresses, the signature, probably some additional metadata. If sender can read sent messages, they should be encrypted and stored twice (encrypted with receiver's private key and sender's private key). Transactions of other types will also consume hard disk space.

Body: Thank you for your comment.  Please see the following post:  Quote from: Azza1070 on April 28, 2018, 09:55:49 AM A lot of users here are asking what the need for the ADAMANT Messenger is when there are so many free messaging applications such as WhatsApp, Telegram, Viber, etc.  To give you some perspective, the main purpose of the ADAMANT Messenger is to provide security, anonymity, and privacy. If these traits are not important to you, then they cannot be compared to free applications that do not provide these features. Many instant free messaging softwares provide some form of verification (usually a phone number or email address), but ADAMANT requires none.  When you use a "free" messenger, you're paying in other ways. Your email address, phone number, public connections, location, IP, device information, interests, images, and other sensitive information is transferred to these centralized companies that decide how to use it. Your information can be sold to any government, coorporation, or conglomerate that they choose. We can see this happening around the world with the use cases of "Big Data".  With ADAMANT, you know exactly what price you're paying. There is nothing hidden, it's an open-source project. You can view a full list of comparisons in the following table: https://image.ibb.co/cPa4gx/ADAMANT_vs_the_rest.png  There are many countries around the world where these features are desperately needed, places that restrict the access of many online applications such as Telegram, WhatsApp, etc. Countries that are run by oppresive regimes and governments that would imprison civilians based on their opposition to ideas of the state. Privacy and freedom is simply a human right, and cannot be denied.  Perhaps some of the users here may be looking at things the wrong way, by comparing ADAMANT to these free messaging applications, thus invalidating the need for any use cases of the ADAMANT Messenger. This is simply not the scenario for every human being in the world. Value from the ADAMANT Messenger will be provided to the individuals that require and use it, regardless of their location around the world.

Author: Azza1070
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: As stated in the ADAMANT Whitepaper (Page 10):  Quote Alternative solutions review and their comparison Messengers are the most popular and convenient way of communication in the modern world. The number of available messengers is counted by hundreds and the amount of people who use at least one messenger is close to 100% of all smartphone and PC owners. However, the percentage of security-oriented and anonymous messengers which are independent from a centralized server (or a group of) is distinctively low. Since ADAMANT‚Äôs main features are security and anonymity, there are only proper alternatives considered within our comparison (this is why we don‚Äôt review such messengers like Kik Messenger, Skype, Google Hangout etc). With respect to the fact that security, anonymity and usability often contradict each other, we do value the messenger‚Äôs accordance to security and anonymity criterias as an advantage in our comparison. For example ‚Äî if the messenger is making a notification about message ‚ÄúRead‚Äù status ‚Äî this kind of behavior is a loss of anonymity for ‚Äúpleasing the usability‚Äù. We had also excluded from our comparison all messengers which does not have a functional prototype: like Echo, Status, Crypviser; and all messengers that are available only for the desktop environments (and do not operate on smartphones): like RetroShare, Tox, Bitmessage, Ricochet.  https://image.ibb.co/cPa4gx/ADAMANT_vs_the_rest.png  Thus ADAMANT is made to solve the confidentiality and security issues.  Please read the full ADAMANT Whitepaper in your chosen language to attain a greater understanding of the ADAMANT Messenger concept here: https://adamant.im/whitepapers-library/

Author: Azza1070
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: From the ADAMANT Whitepaper (Page 24):  Quote ¬´ADAMANT Grows¬ª To make ADM tokens even more valuable, all the dedicated for the ICO campaign tokens being unsold will be distributed among the actual ADM owners ‚Äî their wallet balances will proportionally grow by 5% monthly for an estimate period of a one year after the ICO ends up. As far as ADM is an Utility-token which is used to maintain the network infrastructure, the ADAMANT Grows system is only aimed to protect the conceptual system aspect and not suitable for gaining profits. This distribution will be eventually stopped with the ICO wallet depletion. Therefore, the earlier you‚Äôll support ADAMANT, and the longer you‚Äôll hold your tokens, the more ‚Äúgrow‚Äù-bonuses you‚Äôll get. ‚óè Distribution beginning: 04/11/2018 ‚óè Distribution period: monthly ‚óè Growth percent: 5% ‚óè Distribution closure: eventually with ICO wallet depletion. These wallets do not participate in token distribution campaign: 1. All initial system wallets (ICO, investors rewards, Adoption, reserve wallets); 2. Wallets with their balance being less than 10 ADM tokens. The information about each distribution round details is open (hence will be published on an official website) and all growth transactions are visible through the ADAMANT Explorer.  From the ADAMANT Whitepaper (Page 14):  Quote Infrastructure maintaining and ADM token forging (mining) ADAMANT infrastructure is handled by a system of distributed servers that are running full nodes (blockchain). All servers‚Äô support expenses are covered by ADM tokens forging: 1. Transaction fees 2. Rewards for blocks forging. To participate in forging process, a node should be registered as a network delegate and afterwards receive enough votes from ADAMANT users. Delegate registration fee is 3000 ADM. An ADAMANT user voting for another delegate is required to pay 50 ADM. DPoS scheme functioning algorithm is based on a voting process that proceed in real-time mode (with the use of the reputation level of the network members) which is aimed to create a list of trusted nodes (delegates). After being elected, delegates have the legitimate right to create and verify blocks for adding them to the blockchain and also prevent invasion into the process. These nodes forge (create) blocks one after another in an order that randomly changes after each round. Delegates do forge (obtain or earn) themselves ADM tokens when creating new blocks. The amount of tokens being produced this way is constantly increasing. With the system inception it was to be 0.5 ADM per 1 block, but each 6 307 200 blocks (approximately a year in real time) this number decreases by 0.05 ADM till fit 0.1 ADM. This forging reward increase is going to motivate all delegates to manage the increasing network loads. Regarding the calculations, the delegates will gain these rewards approximately for 140 years, after which the infrastructure will be fully supported by transaction commissions only. The number of active delegates participating in blocks forging is 101. In case when their number is lower than that, these 101 votes will be allocated among the existing members which operate as a full node. The minimum amount of such nodes is 3. The whole system becomes more stable and reliable with the amount of nodes increasing. To create (or forge) new blocks using DPoS, an election do take place in which 101 delegate members are chosen from the delegate pool in order to make all ongoing 101 blocks. The voting is executed by nods (all wallet owners) automatically, based on the trust in particular delegates and their online uptime. After all delegates are being chosen, they are given an order in which new blocks should be formed. Creating a que of 101 blocks approximately takes 8 minutes. Important to note however, that the payment for block forging starts only after the sequence of 2,000,000 first blocks is being created. This measure guarantees that the initial network participants won‚Äôt get their tokens with the minimum amount of effort.  Other than these two incentives, you can sell your tokens when they're listed on exchanges.  Please see the ADAMANT Whitepaper to gain a deeper understanding: https://adamant.im/whitepaper/adamant-whitepaper-en.pdf

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: ADAMANT‚Äôs MainNet has been updated to v.0.2.0 ‚Äî KVS support included Earlier we told that we are working on new mechanism for storing contact data (KVS) in blockchain and on the new transaction type, and had already implemented these innovations in test network. Now the development team has updated the MainNet of ADAMANT up to 0.2.0 with these changes: https://github.com/Adamant-im/adamant/releases/tag/v0.2.0. KVS (key-value store) is a way to store information. For each key (for example, the contact name U324242353425354) a certain value can be stored ("John", for example). KVS is planned to be used to store the address book, user settings and anti-spam, but the real scope of application is bigger. Thus, we have built this mechanism for the future uses. KVS transactions are stored in the blockchain along with transactions of other types and are only available to their owners since transaction's content is encrypted with a private key. ADAMANT provides incremental data storage so the client application only transmits the address book changes, not the entire address book. This is very important for blockchain data storage. Next we‚Äôll update messenger applications, so you‚Äôll be able to use new functionality.

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: We present the parameters storage in blockchain and the new transaction type! The technologies used in messengers have been being developed for a long time, and the creation of a similar product is an ordinary thing now. However, when the time comes for a paradigm shift, every small improvement requires research, design, development, testing ‚Äî this is just about ADAMANT. We are pleased to announce that the ADAMANT team implemented a mechanism for storing contact data (KVS) in blockchain and the new transaction type. KVS (key-value store) is a way to store information. For each key (for example, the contact name U324242353425354) a certain value can be stored ("John", for example). The process of storing contact information in case of common client-server technology is simple and clear. ADAMANT is built on blockchain unlike classic messengers, and each operation requires the generation of a transaction on the client side, the transfer of the signed transaction to a node and the distribution to other nodes with agreement and consensus. KVS is currently used to store the address book, user settings and anti-spam, but the real scope of application is bigger. Thus, we have built this mechanism for the future uses. KVS transactions are stored in the blockchain along with transactions of other types and are only available to their owners since transaction's content is encrypted with a private key. ADAMANT provides incremental data storage so the client application only transmits the address book changes, not the entire address book. This is very important for blockchain data storage. KVS and the new transaction type are now implemented in ADAMANT test network and in the console. As soon as the testing is complete they will be released to the live network within 10 days. What to expect? Soon you will finally be able to save contact names (the address book) and settings, including anti-spam settings.
