Author: d34thkn3ll
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: TL;DR. You say you store messages on the blockchain. Yeah, DPoS, improved speed compared to PoW, but: have you ever considered the amounts of data the full nodes will have to store if your messenger will become popular? Wouldn't it lead to centralization, because only a small amount of nodes will be able to process large amounts of data?  upd: Ok, I've looked through the WP.  I think that the assumption of 300 bytes per message is not very precise, because you also have to store sender and receiver addresses, the signature, probably some additional metadata. If sender can read sent messages, they should be encrypted and stored twice (encrypted with receiver's private key and sender's private key). Transactions of other types will also consume hard disk space.  Telling that your messenger is "secure" and "anonymous" is not very correct too. 1) Assuming that one user has his private key compromised, the stealer gains access to the full message history. 2) As I understand the concept, the fact of conversation between two pseudonymous users can be easily proven. It is possible to build a graph on user's connections. 3) At the moment, browser version of the messenger connects to the public server. The client requests transactions belonging to him with his public key. So at the server (full-node) side it is possible to correlate IP-address with the public key. I'd strongly recommend to use this app only via proxy/tor/vpn.

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: Thanks for joining our Slack!  I'll post a reply here also.  Aleksei Lebedev [11 minutes ago] Hello! Thanks for your deep interest in ADAMANT.   Aleksei Lebedev [7 minutes ago] Yeah, we store messages in blockchain, as well as other transaction types. But as ADAMANT do not plan to replace Facebook, we'll have limited, but specified users auditory. As all of transactions need few disk space, and disk space is cheap enough, that will be not a problem we think.   Aleksei Lebedev [7 minutes ago] As I know all the database sized about 200 MB.   Aleksei Lebedev [6 minutes ago] 1) Yes. We plan to have a possiblity for changing keys within chats.   Aleksei Lebedev [4 minutes ago] 2) You are right again. First thing user can understand there is no way to hide if there is no deep IT knowledge. ADAMANT provide anonymous ID, but it still can be revealed. Later we plan to hide chat transactions in blockchain, like Monero does.   Aleksei Lebedev [2 minutes ago] 3) Yes, but later client will be connected to random node. If there will be many nodes, it will be hard to get IP-public key link. And Tor can be used for sure.   Aleksei Lebedev [2 minutes ago] > If sender can read sent messages, they should be encrypted and stored twice (encrypted with receiver's private key and sender's private key). ‚Äî No, we generate common key for both recepient and sender.   Aleksei Lebedev [1 minute ago] Anyway, there is much space to develop. :slightly_smiling_face:

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: ADAMANT Messenger NEWS  We are glad to announce that the ADAMANT team has implemented ADAMANT Console tool for working with ADAMANT blockchain. https://github.com/Adamant-im/adamant-console Console allows nodes to run for delegates and users to vote for them.  We remind you that the delegates are the main nodes of the network. It is the delegate who forges blocks being constantly on the network, and gets paid for it. In order to become a delegate the node owner pays the comission of 300 ADM and encourages users to vote for him (one vote costs 10 ADM to the user). Users with the larger balance have a stronger vote. The delegates raise their rank by receiving these votes, and the rank determines the block forging queue.  So far we have tested the Console and the voting mechanism on the test network, both these features will be on the live network soon.  Users will be able to vote directly from the messenger apps.

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: ADAMANT Messenger project is being developed since May 2017. During this time the Team has achieved certain results:  A secured and anonymous messenger conception did withstand criticism and found acceptance from the interested audience  A working network infrastructure and testnet have been made  A product has been introduced ‚Äî a Messenger implementation working in a browser (a Progressive Web App solution) and iOS version of the Messenger available to test through the Apple‚Äôs TestFlight  The Messenger had attracted 10 000 users  The creating of ADAMANT Tech Labs legal entity has been started  However we faced a number of difficulties. The ADM token did not suite a number of demands for listing of the major crypto markets. A number of users are not able to buy ADM tokens because of incorrect Whitepaper limitations for the US and China citizens. The Messenger app does not fit the minimum requirements for every day usage.  The project team along with internal and external advisors made a decision that a major changes on the project are needed. These decisions are somewhat forced measures aimed to secure investors‚Äô interests and future product development.  These changes include:  A concept and Whitepaper redesign in accordance with understanding ADM is a Utility-token, intended to be used inside the system for supporting network infrastructure, allowing to buy tokens for US and China citizens  The ADAMANT Tech Labs jurisdiction change from Malta to Ireland. This change is connected with lower tax load and loyal views for crypto projects and anonymous messengers.  Concentration on product development and mobile applications for iOS and Android. Android app development will start in April, ahead of the Roadmap.  ICO prolongation for 3 months, till 06/30/2018. Such a decision is necessary to prepare for listing on crypto markets with significant volumes. While we do not exclude that ADM token will be listed before ICO ends. ADM token price is fixed at 0.004 price until the ICO ends.  In order to encourage earlier token buyers, ‚ÄúADAMANT Grows‚Äù campaign will run as planned, on 04/11/2018  Rewards for current Bounty campaign will be counted and sent as planned, in April of 2018. Registration in current Bounty campaign will be closed in two weeks before its end, on 03/15/2018. We are planning to start new Bounty campaign in April.  Referral campaign extension. Introducing the Dashboard for referrals with traffic exceeding 1,000 hits per day: https://ref.adamant.im. For test access, use login and password: blca / aclb. Referral % can be adjusted by agreement, and received in payment currency or in ETH.  Running alternative colored version of design  If you have questions, ask them in ADAMANT U15738334853882270577, Sergey. You can meet ADAMANT Team at Token2049 conference on 20-21 of March.

Author: adamant.im
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: THERE ARE NO FREE MESSENGERS  Many users ask quesions about ADAMANT Messenger's fees for sending messages. Yes, to send a message, you shoud pay a small fee of about 0.005 ADM per 255 characters. That amount goes to support Messenger's nodes and infrastructure.  First, REMEMBER there are no free messengers. No company will pay for servers and team and more for charity. When you use a "free" messenger, you actually don't know how much you pay. Your email, phone number, public connections, location, IP and device info, interests, images and much more are not yours anymore, they belong to industry companies, and they decide how to use it. Moreover, you can't be sure messages are not read by these companies, as application and protocol source codes are closed. Think about it. ADAMANT is clear ‚Äî you do know how much you pay.  Second, ADAMANT fee is adjustable to ADM token price. Now we gather some feedback from users to decide what is convenient fee. It can be close to zero when the network become stable.  Third, ADAMANT do not target to replace other messengers. Don't need anonymity and security? Use those whatsapps.

Author: tkf
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: Different messengers, for different use cases. Personally i, don't like the idea of sharing eveything with unknown to me creators of different messengers. In the current state adamant have some flaws, but it is a prototype, and it will be better and better. I think that my data, must be mine. Governments seek your data, i can accept it, if they weren't in fact peoples with issues like other people have. But more to it, hundreds of companies also seek your data, to sell it, to monetize on it. Messenger creators, search engine trackers, everyone just want to sell you. "If you're not paying for the product, you are the product.".  I'm not telling that messengers you list are bad, they are good, great, i use many of them aside with adamant. Different instruments, for different purposes.  One silly question to consider -  How "Free Messenger" with no "Ads" and no "Store" can be profitable to pay costs of it's infrastructure?

Author: holydarkness
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: I am feeling really sorry if you see my posts that way, for I had no intention to bring yout project down, or screaming "don't need another app" from the top of my lung. All I intentioned is to point out what might be on readers mind that they're maybe too afraid to ask, or they're choose not to post either because they don't have an account here or they prefer posting is such a burdensome, and decide to leave their interest on this project because they can't find the info they seek, which is probably: what really differentiate you from other app? Why don't I just use this free app? What make adamant so special? And so on.  You have a table explaining this, I know, but I also know that there are a lot of questions that can't be answered by those tables. My question for instance. You are a paid service, and in my humble opinion, people would try to use alternatives, combining this free service plus that free method, trying this and that, before they decide (or learn) to try yours. My posts was intended to point out what's on customers mind, what they try to figure, and by your explanation, helps them to understand, or decide, or even compel them.  I actually still have some other questions to ask, another why-not-this-method-or-that-way posts, because after all, hey, I'm an ordinary user too, so probably what's on my mind is what on a lot of other people's mind too. But it's ok, now I am understand that this app is not for everybody.

Author: tkf
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: Critics with arguments is always good. We understand that user always have choice, and we think that it must have it. Freedom is word that means a lot to us. As i said, may be adamant is for paranoiacs, but if you have paranoia it doesn't mean that you are not watched. We want to have right, to chose what to share with some unknown third parties and what not.  So this is one of the reasons we use adamant. In some countries, what you right in chats with your friends, can be used to put you in prison, or make some offences to you. You think that you are not needed by anyone, but after that they come for you. We want to protect such people. Give them choice. We understand that users would like to try service first, so we credit each new wallet with bounty tokens, which  can be used to get acquainted with the messenger.   Quote from: darherdy on December 26, 2017, 03:52:33 PM What is the function of this project in the future? ADAMANT is not the first one to send information, NXT has a similar function. ADAMANT will be secure and anonymous messenger. ADAMANT Business will be system for communications inside big organisation, with mutual settlements, document signing.  NXT has messaging function, but mainly it is decentralized app platform like ethereum. ADAMANT has other target auditory, and it is main purpose is communication. Also there is no 1000 byte limit.

Author: hoolio
Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure
Body: That's why you use bitcoin addresses only once. And you usually use an encrypted wallet, or a device like Trezor, or 2FA at least, so you don't have to type in your private key every time. But it is easy to intercept someone's passphrase, and after that, if there is some evidence - it's forever there for whoever wants to use it agains you.

Title: üí¨ ADAMANT Messenger ‚Äî ETH/BTC/etc. in-chat payments, open source and secure

I would like Vader voice, or something that is goes from voice to voice in process
